title: top-load_washing_machine
body:
A type of electric [[washing machine]] where the opening to load it is on the top.

Inside the machine the clothes go into a vertical drum where an agitator or impeller inside will move the clothes around while in operation.  They tend to be less common in places where space is a premium as the opening at the top makes it difficult to stack with other washing machines or [[clothes dryer]]s to save in floor space.  Some units do come in a stacked configuration with a dryer on top, but this is usually done through restricting the opening to the washing machine making it more difficult to put in and take out clothing.

As the opening is on the top, this type of washing machine does not need to have a locking mechanism on the door to prevent people from opening it while it operation like a front-load washing machine.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Washing machine (Top-loading)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Washing_machine#Top-loading]

title: yagoo
body:
Tanigou Motoaki is the CEO of Cover corp. which owns [[Hololive]] and [[Holostars]]. The "YAGOO" nickname was born from [[Oozora Subaru]] accidentally misreading his surname during a stream (谷 "tani" can be read as "ya").

During the early days of promoting Hololive, he had described Cover Corp's initial vision of their Virtual Idols as more traditional and conventional in behavior (similar to groups like [[AKB48]], according to him).  As Hololive gained in popularity partly due to the talents' behavior not befitting of the traditional idol mold, he frequently became the target of jokes of "having his idol dreams ruined".

h4. External links

* "Twitter":https://twitter.com/tanigox
* "YouTube":https://www.youtube.com/user/tanigox

title: zaveid_(tales)
body:
[[Tales of Zestiria]] character. A wind seraph who acts cocky and laid-back, but is highly capable as a fighter. He encounters Sorey's party several times, killing hellions when they want to save them and challenging their pacifist beliefs.

He is also seen in [[Tales of Berseria]], primarily as [[eizen (tales)|Eizen]]'s rival. His attitude toward hellions (AKA daemons) is actually reversed in this game, trying to find a way to save them rather than kill them.

h4.Costume Titles

title: ink_(medium)
body:
A medium that consists of [[ink]] which has been applied to a surface, typically paper. The ink can be applied using different tools, such as a [[nib pen (medium)|nib pen]], [[ballpoint pen (medium)|ballpoint pen]], [[millipen (medium)|technical pen]], [[marker_(medium)|marker]], or [[calligraphy brush (medium)|brush]], or through the [[print_(medium)|printmaking process]]. Ink is commonly black, but can be blue, as in the case of some ballpoint pens, or [[color ink (medium)|come in many colors]]. Depending on the method used, ink can appear as lines of constant or varying width, or in large swatches.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Ink":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ink

title: mako_mori
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Pacific Rim]] science fiction mecha series. She appears in the first 2013 live action film and its 2018 sequel, [[Pacific Rim: Uprising]]. 

In the events of the first movie [b]Mako Mori[/b] is a young Japanese Jaeger [[mecha]] pilot with streaked blue and black hair and a [[bob cut]]. She is very brave and skilled at combat, yet very gentle, tender and humane.

In the sequel set 10 years later Mako has become a highly respected (and very efficient) [[Pan Pacific Defense Corps]] senior officer. [spoiler]She sadly (apparently) perished some time later when her transport helicopter was shot down by a [[obsidian_fury|rogue Jaeger mecha]] during a fierce battle in the city of Sidney (Australia) near a PPDC base.[/spoiler]

In [[real life]] she is played by Japanese actress [[Kikuchi Rinko]], while her younger self is played by [[Ashida Mana]].

title: nib_pen_(medium)
body:
A work of [[traditional media]] drawn with a nib pen, a [[pen]] that requires constant dipping in an ink reservoir to function.

An advanced tool, this difficult medium takes a lot of practice to get the hang of, but rewards with rich expression and superior control over one's lines. 

For images that depict a nib pen, use [[nib pen (object)]].

title: fudepen_(medium)
body:
A work of [[traditional media]] drawn with a fudepen. A fudepen (also known as a brush pen) is an ink [[pen]] with a brush-like tip that writes like a traditional [[calligraphy brush]].

The ink used is unlike traditional calligraphy ink. It is designed to adhere well to modern paper, while traditional ink only adheres well to rice paper.

h4. See also

* [[traditional media]]
* [[brush (medium)]]
* [[ink (medium)]]
* [[nib pen (medium)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Fudepen":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fudepen

title: dorami
body:
One of the recurring characters of [i][[Doraemon]][/i]. A yellow "cat robot" from the 22nd century specifically programmed to be a "younger sister" figure of [[Doraemon (character)|]].

She is the production model of Doraemon (a prototype robot) and thus has various features that her brother lacked along with some improvements. She is also a lot lighter despite being only slighty smaller, weighing only 36 kg at a height of 100 cm.

Dorami was bought by [[Nobi Nobita]]'s great-great-grandson [[Nobi Sewashi]] as a household robot after Doraemon was sent to aid Nobita in the past. She is usually portrayed as a somewhat overprotective sister, occasionally traveling from the future to bring Doraemon back for his maintenance.

As with her brother, Dorami also has a "Fouth Dimension Bag" with various gadgets from the future, albeit often with girly aesthetics. As per Sewashi's request, her "ears" was modified into the shape of large red ribbon in the hope that Doraemon would not feel inferior to Dorami for his own missing ears.

title: kosode
body: The kosode (小袖, lit. 'small sleeves') was a type of short-sleeved Japanese garment, and the direct predecessor of the kimono. Though its component parts directly parallel those of the kimono, its proportions differed, typically having a wider body, a longer collar and narrower sleeves. The sleeves of the kosode were typically sewn to the body entirely, and often featured heavily rounded outer edges.

title: b&t_mp9
body:
A 9x19mm [[submachine gun|machine pistol]] manufactured by Swiss company Brügger & Thomet since 2001. It is a further development of the earlier Steyr TMP, originally designed in 1989 and manufactured by Steyr Mannlicher of Austria, before selling it to B&T in 2001. It has a handgun-like configuration, and a tubular [[vertical foregrip]], with additional features new to the MP9 including an integrated Picatinny rail on top, a new trigger safety and a side-[[folding stock]].

h4. See also

* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[TMP (Girls' Frontline)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Brügger & Thomet MP9":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brügger_%26_Thomet_MP9
* "Wikipedia: Steyr TMP":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steyr_TMP

title: ots-33
body:
The [b]OTs-33 Pernach / ОЦ-33 Пернач[/b] (multi-flanged [[mace]]) is a Russian selective fire, 9×18mm Makarov [b][[handgun|machine pistol]][/b].  It was designed to replace the Stechkin APS in various special OMON units within the Russian [[police]], the [[Russia]]n Ministry of Internal Affairs (MVD) and other paramilitary units. The OTs-33 was developed in 1995 by Igor Stechkin at the "TsKIB SOO":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TsKIB_SOO] design bureau, and it went into limited production at the "KBP Instrument Design Bureau":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/KBP_Instrument_Design_Bureau]. Also known as the АП СБЗ-2 (AP SBZ-2). The design was made to resolve the difficulty of controlling recoil in full-auto mode present in the [[Stechkin APS]] and simplifying it for combat deployment. The new OTs-33 has a more square shape, which is simpler to manufacture and has a novel operating principle that increases controllability and reduces recoil.

Easily identified by its boxy slide and ambidextrous (visible on both sides) firing selector switch located on the rear end of the slide as well as a detachable shoulder rig / stock (as seen here: post #3043608).

h1. See also
* [[List of weapons]]
* Wikipedia entry: "OTs-33 Pernach":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OTs-33_Pernach]

title: beretta_93r
body:
The Beretta 93R is an [[italy|Italian]] selective-fire 9×19mm [b][[handgun|machine pistol]][/b], designed and manufactured by Beretta in the late 1970s. Its design is based on the [[Beretta 92]]. The [[weapon]] features a foldable  [[vertical foregrip]], an enlarged trigger guard, six-vent muzzle brake, and a detachable [[shoulder stock]] for steadier firing in three-round burst mode. It accepts extended 20-[[ammunition|round]] [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]].

[[Robocop|Robocop's]] [[Auto-9]] is a modified version of this [[gun]].

h4. See also
* [[Beretta 90two]]
* [[H&K VP70]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Beretta 93R info and images":http://www.berettaweb.com/93R/Beretta%2093R%201.htm
* "Wikipedia: Beretta 93R":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beretta_93R

title: steyr_m1912
body:
The [b]Steyr M1912[/b] or [b]Steyr-Hahn[/b], is a semi-automatic [b][[handgun]][/b] developed in 1911 by the Austrian firm "Steyr Mannlicher":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steyr_Arms]. It was developed for the [[austria-hungary|Austro-Hungarian]] [[Army]] and adopted in 1912, becoming the standard Austro-Hungarian military handgun of [[World War I]]. The M1912 was originally chambered for the 9×23mm Steyr round. After Germany annexed Austria in 1938, the [[Wehrmacht]] ordered 60,000 units rechambered to 9×19mm Parabellum which remained in service until the end of [[World War II]].

The M1912 has integrated magazine which is situated in the grip, so feed system is by 8-round stripper [[clip (weapon)|clips]]. To [[reloading|load]], the slide is pulled back to expose the action, the clip is inserted along the guides and the [[ammunition|rounds]] pushed into the magazine. 

[b]Repetierpistole M1912/P16[/b] is the machine pistol variant which utilizes fixed 16-round integrated magazine and a [[shoulder stock]].

h1. See also
* [[list of weapons]]
* Wikipedia entry: "Steyr M1912 pistol":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steyr_M1912_pistol]

title: ferrari_purosangue
body: Purosangue is a high-performance SUV by Ferrari. It is Ferrari's first SUV and production 4-door vehicle.The Purosangue has a massive 6.5L V12 naturally aspirated engine from its 812 supercar,with both four-wheel drive and four-wheel steering technology.

title: squid
body:
Squid are marine cephalopods of the order Teuthida, which comprises around 300 species. Like all other cephalopods, squid have a distinct head, bilateral symmetry, a mantle, and arms. Squid, like [[cuttlefish]], have eight arms arranged in pairs and two, usually longer, [[tentacles]].

This tag is for living squid. For squid as food, see [[calamari]], [[ikayaki]], or similar.

h4. See also

* [[octopus]]
* [[calamari]]
* [[ikayaki]]
* [[Ikamusume]]
* [[cuttlefish]]

title: swimsuit_hanger
body:
A [[clothes hanger]] designed for [[swimsuit]]s. It's longer than a usual clothes hanger, looking a bit like a curvy rectangle rather than a triangle. The shape is ideal for hanging up a one-piece, but it also allows a single hanger to hold both pieces of a bikini.

h4. See Also

* [[unworn swimsuit]]

title: scarlett_(g.i._joe)
body:
A fictional female character from the [[G.I. Joe]] toy line, comic books, cartoon and live action film series. 

[b]Scarlett[/b] is a [[red hair]]ed G.I. Joe female officer expert in infiltration, [[martial_arts|hand-to-hand combat]], melee weapons and firearms. Her weapons of choice are [[shuriken]]s, mini-[[crossbow]]s and [[handgun]]s. 

She debuted as an [[action figure]] in 1982 and is considered the [b]first G.I. Joe female action figure ever released[/b].

Scarlett is portrayed by actress "Rachel Nichols":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rachel_Nichols_(actress)_ in the 2009 live-action film "G.I. Joe: The Rise of Cobra":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/G.I._Joe:_The_Rise_of_Cobra .

h4. External links

* "[i]Silent Interlude[/i] textless comic":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WIGjpjV4wBY

title: hakurei_shrine
body:
The primary [[shrine]] of [[Gensokyo]] in [[Touhou]] and the personal residence of [[Hakurei Reimu]].

The Hakurei Shrine sits on the border between [[Gensokyo]] and the rest of Earth proper, existing on both sides as the anchor of the Great Hakurei Barrier and accessible from either side, though the Earth-side version is said to appear old and abandoned. Outside world items appear on the grounds from time to time, but no one knows how to consciously cross from one side to the other save for [[Yakumo Yukari]] and Reimu, the latter of whom will send outsiders home if asked.

[[Ibaraki Kasen]], [[Ibuki Suika]], [[Yakumo Yukari]], and Reimu's best friend [[Kirisame Marisa]] are frequent guests. The old turtle spirit [[Genjii (touhou)|]] and the Three Fairies of Light ([[Sunny Milk]], [[Luna Child]], and [[Star Sapphire]]) live in a spring and a tree behind the shrine, respectively. [[Mima (touhou)|]] once haunted the grounds, but has been absent from the games since the PC98 era and is only assumed to still be present. The inchling princess [[Sukuna Shinmyoumaru]] also lived at the shrine in a converted birdcage for a period of time. [[Clownpiece]] has taken up residence in the basement since the events of [[Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom]]. Since becoming animate, [[Komano Aunn]] has taken it upon herself to be the shrine's guard dog. And others ([[Hinanawi Tenshi]], [[Yorigami Shion]], etc) have also taken up temporary residence over the years. The patron god of Hakurei Shrine is unknown, even to Reimu, though theories include Yukari, Mima, and [[Dragon God (Touhou)| the Great Dragon]].

h4. See also

* [[Gensokyo]]

title: genjii_(touhou)
body:
[[Turtle]] familiar of [[Hakurei Reimu (PC-98)|]] in the [[Touhou_(pc-98)|Touhou PC-98]] games. She originally used him as a flying mount, but he hasn't been seen since she learned how to fly on her own between [[Mystic Square]] and [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]], despite ZUN's comments claiming he is retired and now lives in a spring somewhere behind [[Hakurei Shrine]]. His form is that of a turtle with prominent, gray eyebrows and a [[beard]].

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Genjii":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Genjii

title: help:frequently_asked_questions
body:
h4. Uploading

[expand=How do I upload a post?]

On the front page, click "Upload":/uploads/new in the top menu. On the upload page, either paste the link to the image, or click the upload box to upload a file from your computer.

The link doesn't have to be a direct image link. For most sites, you should paste a link to the page containing the image, rather than the image itself. For example, for Twitter and Pixiv you can paste a link to the tweet or Pixiv post, rather than a link to the image itself.

When uploading files from your computer, it's possible to upload multiple files at once by selecting them all in the file picker window. It's also possible to upload ZIP or RAR files.
[/expand]

[expand=What are the upload rules?]

Don't upload content that is poor quality, [[off-topic]], a [[paid reward]], or [[AI-generated]]. Refer to the [[help:upload rules|upload rules]] for more details.
[/expand]

[expand=How do I make uploading easier?]

There are a few tools that make uploading much faster and easier:

* Use the "bookmarklet":/static/bookmarklet or the "Upload to Danbooru":https://github.com/danbooru/upload-to-danbooru#install browser extension to upload images in one click.
* Use the "Pixiv Image Searches and Stuff":https://github.com/nottalulah/userscripts/raw/master/Pixiv_Image_Searches_and_Stuff.user.js and "Translated Pixiv Tags":https://github.com/evazion/translate-pixiv-tags#installation userscripts to check if images have already been uploaded to Danbooru.
* Use the "Image Search Options":https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/image-search-options/kljmejbpilkadikecejccebmccagifhl browser extension to check if something has already been uploaded to Danbooru, or to find the original source.
[/expand]

[expand=How do upload limits work?]

When you first start, you can have up to 15 {{is:pending|pending}} posts in the moderation queue at once. If you hit your upload limit, you have to wait until your uploads are either approved or deleted in three days before you can upload again.

Your upload limit goes up as your uploads are approved, and goes down if your uploads are deleted. When you first start, you need 10 approvals for your upload limit to go up. Every time your limit goes up, you need 2 more approvals to get to the next level. Your limit will go down after every 3 deletions.

See [[about:upload limits]] for more details.
[/expand]

[expand=How does the moderation system work?]

All new uploads go through a moderation queue, where they're reviewed by a team of approvers. Posts have three days to be approved. If they're not approved by anyone in three days, then they're deleted.

All it takes is a single approver liking a post for it to be approved. Posts are only deleted if every approver who sees it doesn't think it's good enough to be approved. Most posts are deleted because multiple approvers saw it and none of them thought it met Danbooru's standards.

Usually there are around 10 to 15 active approvers at any given time. 
[/expand]

[expand=Why did my upload get deleted?]

Usually because it didn't meet Danbooru's quality standards. You can ask for feedback in the "Upload feedback thread":/forum_topics/7934 if you're not sure why something was deleted. Keep in mind there often isn't much to say beyond "it wasn't very good".

If you think your post was unfairly deleted, you can appeal it. Go to the deleted post, then click the "Appeal" button in the sidebar. This will put it back in the moderation queue for another three days, where it has another chance to be approved.

Keep in mind that if you appeal something immediately after it was deleted, it will probably be seen by the same people who passed over it the first time. Waiting a few days can improve your odds.
[/expand]

[expand=I don't like the moderation system]

Deleted posts can still be seen by everyone. They're simply filtered out of searches by default. To see deleted posts, add {{is:deleted}} to your searches or click the "Deleted" button in the sidebar.

If you want to always see deleted posts, you can go to your "account settings":/settings and enable the "Show deleted posts" option. This lets you effectively ignore the moderation system.
[/expand]

h4. Tagging

[expand=How do I tag a post?]

To add a tag, click the "Edit" button beneath the image and add your tags in the "Tags" box. To remove a tag, simply delete the tag from the Tags box. Click the "Submit" button when you're done. 

Anyone can add or remove tags on a post. You don't need any special privileges. All you need is to "create an account":/users/new first.

Tip: you can press "Shift+E" to quickly open the tag edit box in a window, and "Ctrl+Enter" to save the tags when you're done.
[/expand]

[expand=How do I make a new character or copyright tag?]

Tag the post with [code]character:character_name_here[/code] or [code]copyright:copyright_name_here[/code]. For example, tagging a post with [code]character:hatsune_miku[/code] or [code]copyright:vocaloid[/code] would create the [[Hatsune Miku]] or [[Vocaloid]] tags (if they didn't already exist).
[/expand]

[expand=How do I make a new artist tag?]

First tag the post with [code]artist:artist_name_here[/code]. After you add the tag, a message will appear saying that you need to create a new artist entry. Click the "Create new artist entry" button, then add all the artist's profile pages to the URLs section, then click "Submit".
[/expand]

[expand=How do I rename an artist tag?]

Go to the "Artist alias request thread":/forum_topics/7713, click "Request alias/implication":/bulk_update_requests/new?bulk_update_request[forum_topic_id]=7713 at the top of the page, then write [code]alias old_artist_name -> new_artist_name[/code] in the "Request" box. Give a reason in the "Reason" box.
[/expand]

[expand=I'm an artist. How do I rename my artist tag?]

Go to the "Artist alias request thread":/forum_topics/7713, click "Request alias/implication":/bulk_update_requests/new?bulk_update_request[forum_topic_id]=7713 at the top of the page, then write [code]alias old_artist_name -> new_artist_name[/code] in the "Request" box.

If you can't figure it out, just post in the thread and another user will help you.
[/expand]

[expand=What is a "bulk update request"?]

A bulk update request (a BUR for short) is a forum request to change a tag or group of tags. It's a called a bulk update request because it's a request to update one or more tags in bulk.

To make a bulk update request, go to the forum, click "Request alias/implication":/bulk_update_requests/new at the top of the page, then write your request in the "Request" box. Give a reason for the request in the "Reason" box.

This will create a new forum thread where other users can discuss and vote on your request. An admin must approve your request for it to go through. Look at other threads to get a feel for how to write your request.
[/expand]

[expand=What's a tag alias?]

An alias is an alternate name for a tag. For example, [[yellow hair]] is aliased to [[blonde hair]] because yellow hair is the same thing as blonde hair. Searching for [[yellow hair]] will automatically redirect you to [[blonde hair]]. Tagging a post with [[yellow hair]] will automatically add [[blonde hair]] instead.

An alias is used when two tags mean the same thing, or when there are multiple words people might use for the same concept.
[/expand]

[expand=What's a tag implication?]

An implication is when one tag automatically adds another tag. For example, the [[white shirt]] tag implies [[shirt]] because a white shirt is a type of shirt. Tagging a post with [[white shirt]] will automatically add the [[shirt]] tag too.

An implication is used when adding one tag should always add another.
[/expand]

[expand=How do I request that a tag be renamed?]
Go to the forum, click "Request alias/implication":/bulk_update_requests/new at the top of the page, then write [code]alias old_tag_name -> new_tag_name[/code] in the "Request" box. Give a reason for the request in the "Reason" box.

This will create a new forum thread where other users can discuss and vote on your request. An admin must approve your request for it to go through. Look at other threads to get a feel for how to write your request.
[/expand]

[expand=How do I request a tag alias or implication?]

Go to the forum, click "Request alias/implication":/bulk_update_requests/new at the top of the page, then write [code]alias old_tag_name -> new_tag_name[/code] or [code]imply tag1 -> tag2[/code] in the "Request" box. Give a reason for the request in the "Reason" box.

This will create a new forum thread where other users can discuss and vote on your request. An admin must approve your request for it to go through. Look at other threads to get a feel for how to write your request.
[/expand]

[expand=What's a deprecated tag?]

A deprecated tag is a tag that can't be added to new posts. Tags are deprecated when it's decided they should no longer be used, usually because they're too ambiguous, or there are other better tags available.

For example, [[case]] is deprecated because it could mean a [[suitcase]], a [[guitar case]], a [[CD case]], or some other type of case. The [[case]] tag is deprecated to prevent people from still using it.
[/expand]

[expand=What's a tag qualifier?]

A tag qualifier is a word in parentheses at the end of the tag, to disambiguate it from other tags with the same name. For example, in [[arrow (projectile)]] the qualifier is "projectile", to distinguish it from [[arrow (symbol)]].
[/expand]

[expand=What's a copyright tag?]

A copyright tag is a tag for a game, anime, manga, book, movie, or any other kind of fictional universe or property. In general, copyright tags are for things with characters. They're called copyright tags for lack of a better name. Copyright tags are colored purple.

Copyright tags aren't for brand names, company names, trademarks, or other things without characters.
[/expand]

h4. Users

[expand=What are the different user levels?]

Regular users are called Members. Members have blue names.

Builders have purple names. Builders are people who have been promoted for contributing a lot to the site.

Contributors also have purple names. Contributors are uploaders who have been promoted for uploading a lot of high quality posts to the site. Contributors have no upload limits and are allowed to bypass the moderation queue.

Approvers also have purple names. Approvers are in charge of approving and deleting posts.

Moderators have green names. Moderators are in charge of enforcing the rules and banning people.

Admins have red names. Admins are in charge of making site rules and dealing with bulk update requests.
[/expand]

[expand=How do I get promoted?]

You can get promoted to Builder by contributing to the site. This can be uploading, tagging, translating, being helpful in the forums, or anything else to help the site.

You can get promoted to Contributor by uploading a lot of high quality posts. Generally, the criteria is at least 750 approved posts, and a deletion rate of around 5%. Your posts should also be tagged well, and you should have a good understanding of how the site works.
[/expand]

title: butsudan
body: A household altar in Japanese [[buddhism|Buddhist]] culture, meant to provide a place to pray to the Buddha or the dead. A [i]butsudan[/i] can either take the form of a more ornate platform or, more commonly, a [[cabinet]]. When [i]butsudan[/i] are used to revere the dead, one may often find [[iei]], [[incense burner]]s, or [[candle]]s stored inside. Otherwise, they store religious icons such as [[statue]]s of the Buddha or scrolls.

title: mortar_(weapon)
body:
An indirect fire [[weapon]] that fires explosive projectiles at low velocities, short ranges, and high-arcing ballistic trajectories. With an intention to hit the enemy behind cover. It is typically muzzle-loading and has a barrel length less than 15 times its caliber. 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Mortar (weapon)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mortar_%28weapon%29]

title: manabe_nodoka
body:
A secondary character of [[K-On!]].

Childhood friend of [[Hirasawa Yui]] and a member of their school's Student Council. Well-mannered and intelligent, Nodoka, however, is often taken aback by the Light Music Club's easygoing behavior, in particular expressing concern for Yui's progress and annoyance at club president [[Tainaka Ritsu]]'s irresponsibility.

title: ghost_rider
body:
[b]Ghost Rider[/b] is a supernatural antihero in the [[Marvel]] universe. Imbued with the power of hellfire after a deal with the Devil, Ghost Rider takes the form of a biker with a [[flaming skull]] for a head that rides a hellish [[motorcycle]] that can do impossible feats. 

He also has super-human strength and the power to lock eyes with an enemy and make them feel all the pain they have inflicted upon others, a power known as the "Penance Stare".

title: mushroom_man_#2
body: An anthropomorphic [[mushroom]] [[Duel Monster]] with rather unremarkable burn and control-switch effects. Became incredibly handy against Kashtira decks as it could shut down their effects with its control-switch effect. As such, [[Kashtira Riseheart]] loathes this monster with a burning passion in many fan art where they're portrayed together.

title: kashtira_riseheart
body: The embodiment of [[Visas Starfrost|Visas Starfrost's]] anger and the leader of the Kashtira invaders. As such, his fanart constantly depicts him in a state of rage. He absorbs [[Tearlaments Reinoheart]] to become [[Kashtira Arise-heart]]. In fan-art, he's often angry at [[Mushroom Man #2]] because Mushroom Man #2 shuts down the Kashtira effects quite handily.
other_names: クシャトリラ・ライズハート

title: gundam_ms-x
body:
[b][[Gundam]] Mobile Suit X[/b], or [b]MS-X[/b] (エムエスエックス [i]Emuesuekkusu[/i]) for short, is a 1984 series of new [[mecha]] designs and variations of official [[mobile suit]] designs from the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] animated series. 

Just like the [[Gundam MSV]] Mobile Suit Variation (MSV) series of designs, these other mobile suit variations are all legitimate canon and were part of an original design series.

title: elena_jarvinen
body:
A playable character from [[Black Survival]]. A figure skater who is forced to participate in Aglaia's experiments on Lumia Island. She is capable of [[cryokinesis]].

Has [[very_long_hair|very long]] [[light blue hair|light blue]] or [[white hair]] arranged in [[twintails]], [[blue eyes]], and [[small breasts]]. Typically wears a [[blue_dress|blue]] [[figure skating dress]] and [[pantyhose]].

Her surname and nationality differ between [[Black Survival]] and [[Eternal Return: Black Survival]]. In the former, her surname is Lipnitskaya and she is of Russian origin; in the latter, her surname is Jarvinen and she is of Finnish origin. This difference may have been as a result of Russia's 2022 war with Ukraine.

title: tazia_(black_survival)
body:
A playable character from [[Eternal Return: Black Survival]]. An Italian glass artist who participates in Aglaia's experiments on Lumia Island. Known to be a perfectionist, she is able to manipulate glass via her VF powers.

Has [[red hair]], [[yellow eyes]], and [[medium breasts]].

title: 82nd_airborne
body:
A [[United States Army]] division created for [[World War I]], that would then become America's first Airborne Division during [[World War II]]. They saw extensive service throughout the European Theater, including North Africa, Sicily, Italy, the D-Day landings in Normandy, Holland, and the Battle of the Bulge. They are the only remaining true airborne division in the US Army today. (Their WW2-era counterparts, the [[101st Airborne]], are now an air-mobile division using helicopters, rather than an air-borne division that uses parachutes.)

Their unit patch is a blue circle in the middle of a red square background, with the letters "AA" (short for "All-American") in white in the middle. A blue crest running over the square reads "Airborne".

h4. See Also
* [[Unit Patch]]

title: captain_(kemono_friends)
body:
A main character of [[Kemono Friends 3]].

When posts depict the generic Captain, one way to tell their gender apart is that the boy version, when in uniform, wears a blue hat and khaki brown clothes, keeps his brown hair short without adornments, while the girl version wears a baby blue helmet, baby blue/seagreen clothes and keeps her black hair short, with a lock of hair to the right side tied, and small, but noticeable breasts.

title: dragon_knight_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[knight_(dungeon_and_fighter)|Knight]]. Also known as the Braveheart or Dreadnought.

Her "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/e/ec/Dragon_Knight_Art.jpg] has her hair now predominantly black, with the exception of a large part of her bangs remaining pink. She also has dragon-like curved horns. Her outfit is mostly the same as her base class, save for her jacket now being black and the addition of black elbow-length gloves and black thighhighs. Her main summon, a white-scaled baby dragon named Astra, is seen flying beside her.

As a "Dreadnought":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/d/d4/DreadnoughtPortrait.jpg], her horns are slightly larger and her outfit now consists of a long red jacket, white skirt, black stockings, gold gauntlets and black greaves. In the background, Astra is now fully grown, covered in black scales and taking aim with its fire breath.

title: human_tug_of_war
body:
When two or more people have a [[tug of war]] with a person's body. This is usually a fight over an uninterested person's affections.

The Pixiv equivalent tag is "大岡裁き":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/大岡裁き] ([i]Oooka Sabaki[/i], The Judgment of [i]Oooka Tadasuke[/i]). "Oooka Tadasuke":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C5%8Coka_Tadasuke was a highly respected Japanese Judge of the mid-Edo period. When two women claimed to be the true mother of one baby, he asked them to have a tug of war using the baby's hand, knowing that the real mother would refuse to harm the child. This fictional episode is a Japanese adaptation of the Judgment of Solomon.

If the person is only being hugged by two or more people, use [[arm hug]] instead.

title: pl-01
body:
An experimental (and very advanced looking) Polish light battle [[tank]].

The first prototype of the [b]PL-01 Stealth Tank[/b] was created by the Polish Military University of Technology and Military Academy of Land Forces (OBRUM) with support from British defense contractor BAE Systems. The concept vehicle project was first unveiled at the International Defense Industry Exhibition in Kielce on September 2, 2013. A full prototype is estimated to be completed in 2016, and should the project be finalized and approved following evaluation, mass production is scheduled to begin in 2018.

The tank is operated by a crew of 3: the driver, the commander and the gunner. Despite its small size it will be armed with a 105 mm or even a 120 mm caliber main cannon and a 7.62 mm machine gun as secondary armament in an automated unmanned turret. 

The PL-01 was designed with sophisticated stealth materials and systems designed to conceal its signature from modern tank detection equipment. The entire vehicle will be also covered with radio wave absorbent material.

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PL-01

title: lekain
body:
A major antagonist in [[Fire Emblem: Radiant Dawn]], who also appears in [[Fire Emblem: Path of Radiance]] as a minor NPC. 

The Vice Minister of the Begnion Senate and Duke of Gaddos, he is the man responsible for the Serenes Forest Massacre and the assassination of [[Sanaki Kirsch Altina|Sanaki]]'s grandmother, Misaha. He was also arranged to marry [[Astrid (Fire Emblem)|]], until she renounced her title to escape this marriage. After [[Ashera (Fire Emblem)|]] is revived, he proclaims himself "The Chosen One," despite being unaware of how Ashera returned, ultimately being little more than a pawn for [[Sephiran (Fire Emblem)|]], the game’s main antagonist.

He has [[blonde hair]] with a short [[mustache]] that extends into [[mutton chops]], and wears white, elaborate clerical robes with red and gold trim. In [i]Path of Radiance[/i], he also wears a priest’s cap, and his robes are more simplified.

Often a kumiho keeps her yeou guseul in her mouth, and can use it to steal the life force of humans with a kiss.

body:
A [[2012]] remake of the original [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato]] science fiction anime TV series from the [[1970s_(style)|70s]]. It is produced by [[Production IG]] and animated by [[XEBEC]].

It was released as 7 animated movies in Japanese cinemas as well as Blu-ray and DVD volumes from April 2012 onwards. The 26 episodes aired again on TV after all the volumes were released.

The new series is notable because it re-tells the events from the original series' first season, but with brand new animation techniques and more modern character, [[spacecraft]] and [[mecha]] designs. It also introduced many new female characters.

title: dragon_ball_super_super_hero
body:
[b]Dragon Ball Super Super Hero[/b] is the thirteenth movie in the [[Dragon Ball]] franchise, the second to carry the [[Dragon Ball Super]] branding, as well as the fourth Dragon Ball film personally supervised by creator Toriyama Akira. 

Set following the Moro Arc, the film follows a once-more resurgent [[Red Ribbon Army]], under the command of [[Magenta (dragon ball)|]] and his confident [[Carmine (dragon ball)|]], with [[Son Gohan]] and [[Piccolo]] having to face off against opponents such as [[Dr. Hedo]]'s [[Gamma 1]] and [[Gamma 2]]. The film notably ages up some of its characters, with [[Son Goten]] and [[Trunks (dragon ball)|]] finally young adults and [[Pan (dragon ball)|]] approaching her End of Z age, and stars the usual cast alongside newcomers from the previous film, [[Dragon Ball Super Broly]].

title: different_reflection
body:
When something in the [[reflection]] in a [[mirror]] or any reflective surface does not match up with what viewers realistically expect, for instance showing a character's [[dual persona]].

If the reflected image is different due to an [[artistic error]], then use [[bad reflection]] instead. If the reflected image is different because it doesn't show the character's reflection, use [[no reflection]] instead.

title: black_teeth
body:
Blackening of teeth was practiced in Japan since the Kofun period (3rd century) for health and aesthetic purposes, with the practice dying out in the early 20th century.

Depictions making their way to Danbooru may be [[artistic error]]s due to miscoloration by the artist. Characters most likely to be intentionally depicted with black teeth may be [[kitsune]], [[geisha]], or [[oiran]].

title: ishi_no_hana
body:
Manga by [[Sakaguchi Hisashi]], running from 1983 to 1986, set during [[World War II]]-era [[Yugoslavia]]. The title, rendered in Serbo-Croatian as 'Kameni cvet / Камени цвет', references the Stone Flower monument which serves as a reminder of the atrocities committed at the Jasenovac concentration camp. The manga would see renewed interest in the 90s, as a source of knowledge for readers contextualizing the then-ongoing Yugoslav Wars.

Editions of the manga after the 80s Ushio Publishing releases (ex. Shinchosha) would feature extensive redraws, which has some fans split. The 2022 Kadokawa-published editions, based on the Shinchosha editions, would feature as a bonus two earlier chapters made by Sakaguchi adapting the 1969 Yugoslav film '"Krvava bajka":[https://www.filmneweurope.com/news/serbia-news/item/123557-serbian-classic-sold-for-comic-book-adaptation-in-japan]', published in the August and September 1970 issues of Manga-Ou, which are considered the origin of Ishi no Hana's eventual creation. Despite the subject matter, the manga has only ever been released outside of Japan in French as 'Fleur de pierre,' and awareness of the manga in former Yugoslavia is sparse but growing.

h4. External link
* Wikipedia: "Ishi no Hana (Sakaguchi Hisashi manga)":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%9F%B3%E3%81%AE%E8%8A%B1_(%E5%9D%82%E5%8F%A3%E5%B0%9A%E3%81%AE%E6%BC%AB%E7%94%BB)] (Japanese)
* MangaHelpers: "Ishi no Hana":https://mangahelpers.com/m/ishi-no-hana

title: mai_natsume
body:
Mai Natsume is the protagonist of the manga [[BlazBlue Remix Heart]] and [[BlazBlue Variable Heart]], illustrated by [[Sumeshi (ambivalince)|]], as well as of two side-stories in [[Blazblue: Chronophantasma|BlazBlue Chronophantasma Extend]] and appears as a playable character in [[Blazblue: Central Fiction]]. She's voiced by [[Hayami Saori]] in Japanese, and [[Stephanie Sheh]] in English.

She was a classmate and friend of [[Noel Vermillion]], [[Tsubaki Yayoi]], [[Makoto Nanaya]], [[Kajun Faycott]] and [[Shiori Kirihito]] during their time at the Military Academy. After leaving the academy Mai worked for [[Kokonoe (blazblue)|]] at Sector Seven.

Mai is the vessel of the Nameless Grimoire, which allows her to read people's thoughts or memories or obtain information about objects by tasting them. Her true name is Mai Hazuki and she's the heir of the Hazuki Family, one of the twelve noble families that govern the world. Shortly prior to the events of Remix Heart, the Nameless Grimoire inadvertently fused with her body and transformed Mai from a boy into girl. She was not able to reverse the transformation and her father sent her to the Torifune Military Academy under an alias. While Mai initially wanted to return to her previous form, she eventually became female in both body and mind, came to accept her new form and now considers herself to be a woman.

Mai was given a powerful magic spear called [[Outseal]] by Kajun in Variable Heart, that she used ever since as her preferred weapon.

She has [[very_long_hair|very long]] [[blue hair]], [[purple eyes]], and [[huge breasts]].

As Mai's own media almost always portrays her in female form, she only warrants the [[genderswap_(mtf)]] tag for pics that include her male form or otherwise allude to her originally being male. See topic #11614 for details.

title: m26_pershing
body:
First conceived as a heavy [[tank]] during the later stages of [[World War II]], the M26 Pershing saw service near the end of the war in Europe, destroying just 7 German tanks. It later served in the Korean War alongside [[M4 Sherman|M4A3 'Easy Eight' Shermans]], fighting off [[T-34|T-34/85s]] and emerging on the winning side.

Although its military career was short lived, if it weren't for this vehicle, the [[M46 Patton]], as well as the subsequent [[M47 Patton|M47]], [[M48 Patton|M48]] or [[M60 Patton]] wouldn't even exist...

h4. See also

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]
* [[Girls und Panzer]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "M26 Pershing":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M26_Pershing

title: karl_gerat
body:
"Karl-Gerät" (Karl-device), also known as Mörser Karl, was a [[World War II]] German self-propelled siege [[mortar (weapon)|mortar]]. Its heaviest munition was a 60 cm (24 in) diameter, 2,170 kg (4,780 lb) shell, and the range for its lightest shell of 1,250 kg (2,760 lb) was just over 10 km (6.2 mi). Each gun had to be accompanied by a crane, a heavy transport trailer, and several modified tanks to carry shells.

h4. See also

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]
* [[Girls und Panzer]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Karl-Gerät":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karl-Gerät

title: is-2
body:
The [b]IS tank[/b] (or [b]Iosif Stalin Tank[/b]) was a series of heavy [[tank]]s developed as a successor to the [[KV-2|KV-series]] by the [[Soviet]] Union during [[World War II]]. It was named after Soviet leader [[Joseph Stalin]]. 

The heavy tank was designed with a very thick armor to counter the German 88 mm guns, and carried a very powerful main gun that was capable of defeating the German [[Tiger I]] and [[Panther (tank)|]] tanks in one shot. 

Because of its low mobility and speed it was mainly a breakthrough tank, firing a heavy high-explosive shell that was useful against heavy fortifications like entrenchments and bunkers.

h4. See also

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]
* [[Girls und Panzer]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "IS-2":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IS_tank_family#IS-2

title: panther_(tank)
body:
A medium [[tank]] deployed by [[Nazi]] [[Germany]] in [[World War II]] from mid-1943 to the end of the European war in 1945. It was intended as a counter to the [[Soviet]] [[T-34]], and as a replacement for the [[Panzer III]] and [[Panzer IV]]. While never replacing the latter, it served alongside it and the heavier [[Tiger I]] until the end of the war.

Until 1944, it was designated as the [b]Panzerkampfwagen V Panther[/b] and had the ordnance inventory designation of Sd.Kfz. 171. On 27 February 1944, [[Adolf Hitler]] ordered that the Roman numeral V be deleted from the designation.

h4. See also

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]

title: panzer_i
body:
The first of the mass produced German [[tank]]s of the interwar period, mainly as a training model for both military and industrial known-how.

Armed with only [[machine gun]]s and small in size, the type was not expected to be used in actual combat. Despite this the type served as the backbone of the German Panzer divisions in the early campaigns of [[World War II]]. The hull of the design was later used for various self-propelled guns and other support vehicles.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Panzer I":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Panzer_I

title: panzer_ii
body:
The second major mass produced [[tank]] of Germany during the interwar period. A rather light design armed with autocannon and [[machine gun]]s. Mainly designed for training but went on to serve as the backbone of the Panzer forces during the early campaigns of [[World War II]].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Panzer II":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Panzer_II

title: panzer_iv
body:
The [b]Panzerkampfwagen IV[/b] (Pz.Kpfw. IV), commonly known as the [b]Panzer IV[/b], was a medium [[tank]] developed in [[Nazi]] Germany in the late 1930s and used extensively during [[World War II]]. Its ordnance inventory designation was Sd.Kfz. 161.

Designed as an infantry-support tank, the Panzer IV was not originally intended to engage enemy armor—that function was performed by the lighter [[Panzer III]]. However, with the flaws of pre-war doctrine becoming apparent and in the face of [[Soviet]] [[T-34]] tanks, the Panzer IV soon assumed the tank-fighting role of its increasingly obsolete cousin. The most widely manufactured and deployed German tank of the Second World War, the Panzer IV was used as the base for many other fighting vehicles, including the [[Sturmgeschutz IV]] assault gun, [[Jagdpanzer IV]] tank destroyer, the Wirbelwind self-propelled anti-aircraft weapon, and the Brummbär self-propelled gun.

h4. See also

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Panzer IV":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Panzer_IV

title: panzer_iii
body:
A medium [[tank]] that was developed in the 1930s by Germany and was used extensively in [[World War II]].

The official German designation was Panzerkampfwagen III Sd Kfz. 141 (abbreviated PzKpfw III or Panzer III) translating as "armored fighting vehicle". It was intended to fight other armored fighting vehicles and serve alongside the infantry-supporting [[Panzer IV]]. However, as the Germans faced the formidable [[T-34]], stronger anti-tank guns were needed. The Panzer IV had a bigger turret ring and so the roles were reversed. The Panzer IV mounted the long barreled 7.5 cm KwK 40 gun and engaged in tank-to-tank battles. The Panzer III became obsolete in this role and for most purposes was supplanted by the Panzer IV. From 1942, the last version of Panzer III mounted the 7.5 cm KwK 37 L/24, better suited for infantry support.

Production of the Panzer III ended in 1943. However, the Panzer III's capable chassis provided hulls for the [[Sturmgeschutz III]] until the end of the war.

h4. See also


* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]

title: camel_spider
body:
An [[arachnid]] order known as the Solifugae, characterized by its large chelicerae (mouthparts). Camel spiders also feature what looks like 5-pairs of legs, though the the first pair are pedipalps instead of legs and are used as a set of feelers.  The first pair of real legs are also used as feelers and are typically smaller and thinner than the rear 3 pairs of legs used for walking.

Note that the Solifugae and Araneae (common [[spider]]s) are from different orders.



h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Solifugae

title: shark_penis
body:
Male [[shark]] reproductive organ, also known as "claspers".

While called a "[[penis]]" here, the shark's claspers are specially adapted fins which are used to anchor the male shark to a female shark during mating.
Unlike a typical penis, claspers are not involved in the insemination process, lack a urethra, and do not ejaculate.

title: g_(genesis1556)
body:
Artist.

Nickname: "G"

h4. Original characters

* [[Annes (g (genesis1556))|Annes]]: Blue-themed dragon girl with a stoic demeanor, [[one-eyed|one eye]], and often carrying an [[ootachi]]. Has an apparent mutual dislike of Dein.
* [[Arisa (g (genesis1556))|Arisa]]: Yellow-themed dragon girl with two extendable barbed spearlike organs growing from the tip of her tail. Has a lesbian crush on Annes.
* [[Dein (g (genesis1556))|Dein]]: Red-themed dragon girl with a [[muscular female|muscular]] and [[scar|scarred]] physique, often wearing a [[fur-trimmed coat]] and [[smoking]] a [[cigarette]] or [[cigar]]. Has an apparent mutual dislike of Annes.
* [[Karutia (g (genesis1556))|Karutia]]: Green-themed dragon girl who is an old friend of Tsubasa Ryuuji. [[Bisexual]] and often drawn provocatively.
* [[Rara (g (genesis1556))|Rara]]: Dragon girl with whitish-pink hair and a younger appearance than the others. Initially portrayed as having a [[yandere]] crush on Rio.
* [[Leia (g (genesis1556))|Leia]]: Pink-themed dragon girl and the most openly sexual of G's characters, with an incestuous attraction to her brother Rio.
* [[Lily (g (genesis1556))|Lily]]: "Dark" version of Lala with [[dark skin]], [[heterochromia]], and flower [[tattoo]]s.
* [[Lutian (g (genesis1556))|Lutian]]: Icy-blue-themed dragon girl with [[yellow eyes]] and a stern demeanor.
* [[Meldine (g (genesis1556))|Meldine]]: Blue-and-white themed dragon girl starring in "A Boy-Eating Young Woman Has Appeared!!":/pools/16166, where she seduces Shota-kun.
* [[Miguel (g (genesis1556))|Miguel]]: Dragon boy with grey-brown hair and fur covering his arms, sexually assertive, and has an attraction to Rio's gender-bent form.
* [[Mia (g (genesis1556))|Mira]]: Black-themed dragon girl with red eyes, shows little emotion.
* [[Rio (g (genesis1556))|Rio]]: Black-and-white-themed dragon boy, often subject to the advances of G's other dragon girls, frequently caught in the middle of the local cetaceans' brawls, and sometimes gender-bent.
* [[Ryuuga (g (genesis1556))|Ryuuga]]: Black-themed dragon girl with similarities to Dein, possessing a [[muscular female|muscular]] and [[scar|scarred]] physique, often drawn wearing an open coat and [[smoking]]. Unlike Dein, she has [[dark skin]] and prefers to smoke a [[smoking pipe|pipe]].
* [[Shota-kun (g (genesis1556))|Shota-kun]]: A young, brown-themed dragon boy starring in "A Boy-Eating Young Woman Has Appeared!!":/pools/16166, where he is seduced by Meldine.
* [[Tsubasa Ryuuji]]: An [[original]] [[female admiral (kancolle)|]] and star of "Half Dragon Admiral":/pools/9099.

title: spartan_(destroid)
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[MACROSS]] series. It first appeared in [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV anime series from 1982.

The [b]Centinental/Kransmann MBR-07-Mk II Spartan[/b] [[destroid]] is a main [[battle]] [[robot]] system (mecha) created by the [[U.N. Spacy]] to fight the [[Zentradi]].

This is a heavy armored and armed mecha. It has two launchers with several [[missile]]s for long to mid range attacks, as well as a concealed gun cluster in its torso with a [[flamethrower]], a [[grenade launcher]], a [[machine gun]] and an [[energy cannon]]. 

Besides its ranged weapons the mecha also possess two powerful manipulators (hands) designed to rip through the armor of most Zentradi mecha. It can also be equipped with a heavy [[baton]] for [[giant]] [[maclone]] riot control.

In [[real life]] the Spartan was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the early 80s.
other_names: デストロイド・スパルタン

body:
A fictional NPC character from the [[Gundam Battle Operation 2]] online multiplayer [[video game]].

[b]Neidhardt Heidegger[/b] is the grumpy, tall, bald and rude looking manager of the Private Military Union (P.M.U.) Base Camp, and [[Tenda Begin]]'s adoptive father. Neidhardt is responsible for giving the players their mission rewards.

title: tenda_begin
body:

[b]Tenda Begin[/b] was orphaned during an unspecified war and was adopted by [[Neidhardt Heidegger]]. She is in charge of assigning the player's training missions.

title: leona_lucraft
body:
A fictional female NPC character from the [[Gundam Battle Operation 2]] online multiplayer [[video game]].

[b]Leona Lucraft[/b] is an expert [[mobile suit]] mechanic and workaholic that, despite her relatively young age, has an expansive career working with machinery, dating back to when she was a child. She works at the P.M.U. Hangar and is in charge of upgrading the player's [[mecha]].

body:
Tag used to describe visible thread-holdings on clothing or ones body, you will often see this on [[stuffed animal|stuffed animals]] and [[zombie|zombies]] too. It has a distinctive train track look or appear as X's going in a line.

Sutures (also known as stitches) are used to hold skin and all other tissues of the human body together, after someone has been injured or went through surgery. This is done with a [[needle]] and preformed by a [[doctor]] or [[nurse]].

Not to be confused with [[stitched]].

title: grand_zamboa
body:
* [b]Japanese:[/b]（グランゼボーマ）[Guranzeboma]

A mecha piloted by the [[Antispiral|Anti-Spiral]] during the last episode of [[Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann]]. It was created to battle the [[Tengen Toppa Gurren-Lagann (mecha)|Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann]] mecha on even grounds.

* Visually, it resembles a black, skeletal version of Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann.
* On the same way that Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann is a manifestation of [[Spiral Power]], Grand Zamboa is a manifestation of "absolute despair".
* Despite being an Anti-Spiral machine, it is capable of using drills as weapons; however, instead of having spiral grooves, the grooves are straight from the tip of the drill to its base.

A regular part of its ad campaign is the 30-minute guarantee that started from 1973 to 1993, stating that customers would receive their delivered pizzas within 30 minutes or it was free but ended the practice in 1993 due to many car accidents and deaths caused by Dominos delivery drivers trying to reach their destination quickly.

Menu items include a variety of chicken tenders, [[french fries]], [[burger|burgers]], and selections of internationally themed foods such as tacos and egg rolls. Their mascot is [[Jack Box]].

title: the_king_(burger_king)
body:
The mascot of [[Burger King]]. Originally known as "The Burger King", he became just "The King" following the introduction of his most famous iteration in 2004. This iteration appeared in costume form with an oversized full-face grinning mask, often appearing in various unexpected places to offer people Burger King food.

Due to the mask making him fall in the uncanny valley, he may be seen as creepy. As a result, he has been used less since 2011, but still makes appearances every now and again.

title: data_east
body:
[b]Data East Corporation[/b] (株式会社データイースト [i]Dēta Īsuto Kabushikigaisha[/i]) also abbreviated as [b]DECO[/b], was a legendary Japanese [[video game]] developer and publisher company active from 1976 to 2003, when it declared bankruptcy. 

Their main headquarters were located in Suginami, Tokyo. The American subsidiary, Data East USA, had been headquartered in San Jose, California.

Data East proved to be one of the more successful and long-lasting companies in the business, surviving the video game crash of 1983 in reasonably good shape and going on to release dozens of games for both arcade and home console systems over the next two decades. Some of their most famous coin-op arcade games from their 80s heyday included [[Metal Clash]], [[Karate Champ]], [[Heavy Barrel]], [[BurgerTime]], [[Dragonninja]], [[Sly Spy]], [[RoboCop]], [[Bump 'n' Jump]], Trio The Punch – Never Forget Me..., [[Karnov]] and [[Atomic Runner Chelnov]]. Karate Champ was the first successful fighting game, due to being one of the most influential to modern fighting game standards. During the late 80s and the 90s they also produced games like [[Midnight Resistance]], [[Crude Buster]], the [[kuhga|Vapor Trail]] trilogy and the [[Joe & Mac: Tatakae Genshijin]] and [[Fighter's History]] series.

Data East also purchased licenses to manufacture and sell arcade games created by other companies. Their most successful licensed games included [[Kid Niki: Radical Ninja]], [[spartan_x|Kung Fu Master]] and [[Vigilante]], all licensed from Irem, and [[Senjou no Ookami]] (Commando), licensed from [[Capcom]]. They had a brief stint as a [[Neo Geo]] arcade licensee in the mid-1990s, starting with [[Spinmaster]].

title: who_is_nijika?_(meme)
body:
A copypasta originating from a comment under the video "Metric - Lost Kitten Nijika (Bocchi the Rock)":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jkAr25tA7SA], a variation on the "If X has a million fans, I am one of them" format focused on [[Ijichi Nijika]]. It goes as follows:

Who is Nijika?
For the blind, she is vision.
For the hungry, she is the chef.
For the thirsty, she is water.
If Nijika thinks, I agree.
If Nijika speaks, I’m listening.
If Nijika has a million fans, I am one of them.
If Nijika has ten fans, I am one of them.
If Nijika has only one fan, that is me.
If Nijika has no fans, I no longer exist.
If the whole world is against Nijika, I am against the whole world.
I will love Nijika until my very last breath.

Variations on post #6764418, the image used in the thumbnail for the video, are common.

The uniform consists of a [[cropped shirt]], [[sleeveless shirt]], [[detached sleeves]], [[blue sailor collar]], loose [[waist ribbon]], and a [[pleated skirt]].

title: colt_commando
body:
The Colt Commando (also known with designations [b]XM177[/b] or GAU-5) is an [[united states|American]] 5.56×45mm NATO [[assault rifle]]. It is essentially the shorter variant of the [[M16A1]]. Entered service in 1966, the weapon saw first use during the [[Vietnam War]].

The term CAR-15 originally refers to any Colt-marketed [[AR-15]], but it became associated with this [[military]] variant. 

h4. See also

* [[Colt 9mm SMG]] [[submachine gun]]
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[M4 Carbine]] [tn](based on the shortened [[M16A2]])[/tn]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: CAR-15 XM177":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CAR-15_XM177
* "Weaponsystems.net: Colt Commando":https://weaponsystems.net/system/246-Colt+Commando

title: papel_picado
body: Papel Picado ([i]"pecked paper"[/i]) is a traditional Mexican folk art, created by cutting intricate designs into tissue paper. Often hung as decoration during major holidays such as [[Christmas]] and [[Dia de Muertos]].

title: la_catrina
body:
[i]La Calavera Catrina[/i], a 1910 satirical etching by José Guadalupe Posada depicting a lavishly dressed female skeleton. 
The character has since become an icon of [[Dia De Muertos]], with many revelers dressing up as her with [[calavera]] makeup.

Her male equivalent is [[El Catrin]].

title: calavera
body: Stylized [[skull]]s associated with [[Dia de Muertos]]. Usually seen in the form of sugar skulls, and [[makeup]] and decorations based on them.

title: tales_of_destiny
body:
The second mothership title in the [[Tales of (series)|]] series developed by Namco for the Playstation 1, then entirely remade for the Playstation 2.

It follows [[Tales of Phantasia]]'s gameplay very closely, but is credited for introducing the concept of skits - in the original Japanese PS1 version, the characters speak to each other while walking on the overworld map. ToD is followed by a sequel, [[Tales of Destiny 2]].

title: vladimir_putin
body:
[b]Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin[/b] ([b]Влади́мир Влади́мирович Пу́тин[/b], b. 7 October 1952)

Current president (2000-2008, 2012- ) and former prime minister (1999-2000, 2008-2012) of the [[Russia|Russian Federation]] and former [[Soviet]] [[KGB]] agent.

A controversial figure, he has initially developed a cult following in [[Japan]], who often depict him as "the manliest and most unstoppable leader on earth". This has reached the point that there is a [[comic|manga]] based of his public image as well as an annual calendar of him being sold in Japan. Though his memetic status has been significantly subsided after he ordered [[russo-ukrainian_war|the invasion of Ukraine in 2022]].

h1. See also
* [[Tag group:People]]
other_names: ウラジーミル・プーチン

title: nabe
body:
Any of a number of communally shared Japanese dishes cooked in a clay or iron hot pot, right at the table.  Diners dip in the components they wish into the shared broth and then retrieve them when they are cooked to taste.  Nabe is frequently served with a dipping sauce ([i]tare[/i]).

h4.  Common types of nabe

* [[Oden]] - A mix of [[hardboiled egg]]s, [[fish cake]], [[daikon]] radish, [[konnyaku_(food)|konnyaku]], and other ingredients.
* [[Sukiyaki]] - A mix of thinly-sliced beef, [[spring onion]], [[tofu]], [[mushroom]], leafy green vegetables, and noodles.

h4.  See also

* [[Hotpot]]
* [[Neko nabe]]
* [[Tag group:Food tags]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Nabemono":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nabemono

title: mikumikudance
body:
Miku Miku Dance (MMD) is a freeware [[3D]] animation software, named after [[Vocaloid]] character [[Hatsune Miku]] for which it was originally created. Though models can be ported for use with it, often users create their own models for the software for use, which may contain their own distinct quirks. Use this tag for images that reference/[[parody]] the software.

For images created with the software, head over to [[MikuMikuDance (medium)]].

title: laurels
body:
Small leaves of the [i]Lauraceae[/i] family of shrubs. These are typically woven together to form a [[laurel crown]].

Often used to represent popular acclaim, great successes in war, or (in Greco-Roman derived mythology) divinity.

h4. See also
* [[olive branch]]
* [[wreath]]

title: olive_branch
body:
A [[branch]] from the olive tree. Originally a symbol of supplication in Greco-Roman culture, in modern day usage the olive branch has come to be seen as a symbol of peace. Often depicted in the mouth of a [[dove]].

h4. See also
* [[laurels]]
* [[wreath]]

title: zas_m76_(dancer_of_the_night)_(girls'_frontline)
body:
[[Zas M76 (girls' frontline)|]]'s first skin from [[Girls' Frontline]], as part of the game's fourth anniversary 'Soiree Sonata' skin collection in 2020.

Zas M76 switches out her usual beret for a smaller [[black headwear|black]] [[beret]] with a red-and-white [[hat ornament]], allowing her to add two [[hair flower]]s and [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon]] for the occasion. Her formal attire consists of a [[black dress|black]]-[[gradient dress|to]]-[[red dress|red]] [[asymmetrical dress]], leaving the left side of her body slightly more exposed, with only a [[black bandeau|black]] [[bandeau]] keeping her covered. Around her waist, the black of the dress transitions briefly into stark red by way of the [[Yugoslavian flag]] and [[olive branch]] dress ornament, connecting into its [[red sash|red]] [[sash]].  Paired with the dress is a small [[black scarf|black]] [[scarf]], [[black gloves|black]], [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[elbow gloves]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heel boots|high heel]] [[thigh boots]], with a discrete knife [[sheath]] hidden near their top, with [[red ribbon]]s trailing to the ground. With her, she has a filled [[wine glass]], and a [[weapon case]] upon which the Serbian [[coat of arms]] are emblazoned. Both are discarded in favor of her namesake rifle when damaged.

title: imminent_netorare
body:
As [[netorare]] involves infidelity in which someone close to the protagonist (usually someone's lover, though the dilution of the word has meant that it has also been applied to friends, unrequited love interests, or even relatives) is usually unwillingly seduced and stolen away, imminent netorare involves images where that taking away will soon occur. 

Posts on Danbooru tagged with this should include [[doujin cover]]s for doujin where the theme is netorare; pools and parent posts where the end result is netorare; and the moments before netorare occurs. The one taking the loved one can be present, but cannot be actively penetrating or otherwise taking the loved one.

title: happy_chaos
body:
A character introduced in [[Guilty Gear]] [[Guilty Gear Strive|Strive]].

He is the main antagonist of the Story Mode and [spoiler]former mentor to [[Asuka R. Kreutz]], as well as the discoverer of magic and the dimension that makes it possible. He was transformed into his current being as a result of him discovering [[I-no]] in said dimension.[/spoiler]

He is a mass manipulator, influencing events from beyond the Backyard and controlling individuals such as [[Nagoriyuki]] with his seemingly limitless magic abilities. In gameplay, he primarily uses two [[handgun|handguns]].

title: asuka_r._kreutz
body:
A mysterious character in [[Guilty Gear]]. Appears in several story modes and side material. He is the one who created the Gears, and various characters, including [[Sol Badguy]], [[Baiken]], and [[Axl Low]], are chasing after him for various reasons.

[spoiler]He turned one of his coworkers into the very first Gear, this person would later be renamed as Sol Badguy. He is also the actual person responsible for destroying Japan. However, he lost control over the Gears to the Universal Will and destroying Japan was a drastic response to the Universal Will doing something that would be far worse (basically, she was turning all Japanese people into Gear-shaped nukes), the event also made him lose control of [[Justice (guilty gear)|]].[/spoiler]

In official media prior to the reveal of his full name (and still very commonly in unofficial media up until his addition as a playable character in 2023), he was called simply "That Man", literally "あの男". His long period of activity, seclusion from humanity, and seemingly indecipherable actions across a wide range of appearances and aliases over hundreds of years led to him simply being referred to as That Man, as in, you-know-who.

[spoiler]It would later be revealed that Asuka had done very few of the crimes he was believed to; the real "That Man" was, in fact, [[Happy Chaos]].[/spoiler]

title: zastava_m21
body:
A series of Serbian 5.56×45mm NATO [b][[assault rifle]]s[/b]. Heavily based on the [[kalashnikov rifle|AK platform]], it was designed by Marinko Petrović and manufactured by "Zastava Arms":[https://www.zastava-arms.rs/en/home/] since 2004.

The current models use a 1.5mm thick stamped receiver. The M21 can incorporate picatinny rails for mounting accessories like [[optical sight]]s, [[foregrip]]s, [[bipod]]s, etc.

The Zastava M21 is gas operated, long stroke piston with a rotating bolt locking system [[rifle]]. It features a hard chromium-plated, cold forged standard rifled or an optional polygonal rifled barrel, integrated 22mm [[muzzle device]] [[grenade launcher]], heavy-duty dark/black synthetic furniture similarly to the [[AK-74M]] with a polymer side-folding stock, and side optics rail as standard (optional adapter base for cover mounted picatinny rail also available). The rifle can also mount a 40mm [[underbarrel grenade launcher]]. It is fed with standard 30-round [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]]. The cyclic rate of fire is 680 rounds per minute, sustained one is 120 RPM. 

h1. Variants
* [b]M21 A[/b] – Standard baseline assault rifle.
** M21 ABS – Built-in picatinny rail system.
* [b]M21 S[/b] – Compact short barrel assault rifle.
** M21 SBS – Built-in picatinny rail system.
* [b]M21 C[/b] – Carbine.
** M21 BS – Built-in picatinny rail system.

body:

title: tau_(iron_saga)
body:
[[Iron Saga]] character. Tau is not her real name but rather a code name as a member of the Takahashi family's special unit. Diligent to a fault, but occasionally shows her airhead side at times. The youngest of three sisters, she deeply treasures her two elder sisters. She loves reading yuri genre novels and occasionally has delusions of her two older sisters in a lesbian relationship.

title: hanzo_hasashi
body:
[[Mortal Kombat (series)|]] character. A member of the Shirai Ryu clan of [[ninja]].

In the first two timelines, he was one of the greatest assassins of the Shirai Ryu, but Hanzo would be killed in an attack that claimed his wife [[Harumi Shirai|Harumi]], his son [[Satoshi Hasashi|Satoshi]] and his entire clan. He would be brought back as the undead ninja specter known as [[Scorpion (mortal kombat)|]]. Burning with rage, Scorpion sought vengeance against the Lin Kuei, the Chinese ninjas responsible for the attack, and [[Sub-Zero]] in particular for killing him. But unbeknownst to Hanzo, the demon sorcerer [[Quan Chi]] was the true author of the events that led to the fall of his clan and his family's deaths.

In the original timeline, he would remain eternal rivals with the second Sub-Zero, [[Kuai Liang]]. In the rebooted timeline, he would learn the truth behind his fall of his clan, and make peace with the Lin Kuei to fight against Quan Chi. As such, up until 2023, all depictions of Scorpion were Hanzo. In the [[Mortal Kombat 1 (2023)|third timeline]], the position of Scorpion would be taken over by Kuai Liang. [spoiler]He would end up joining the then-newly-formed Shirai Ryu under Scorpion as a kid.[/spoiler] In the first season of MK1's Invasion Mode, Hanzo's Scorpion appears as 'Hellfire Scorpion', invading after defeating Kronika in his timeline, attempting to find a Harumi to be with, which ultimately ends with [spoiler][[Liu Kang]] finding a timeline for him where she was alone... because the Hanzo of her timeline had died, resulting in her becoming Scorpion instead.[/spoiler]

title: winged_victory_mercy
body:
[[Official alternate costume]] of [[Mercy (Overwatch)|]] from [[Overwatch]], depicting her wearing [[Ancient Greek clothes]].

Wears a [[laurel crown]], a [[chiton]], with a short [[peplos]] pinned over it using two fibula brooches. 

The peplos is an exaggerated Spartan-style peplos, with side slits. This is worn to give a [[pelvic curtain]] or a 'tabard'-like appearance. Most fan artists will not depict the peplos. Instead Mercy's upper garments will be merged into a single [[chiton]] 'dress', with the brooch-pins being purely vestigial. Such cases should not be tagged [[peplos]].

The crotch flap and other dangly cloth bits may often be depicted as wrapped around her other clothes. Tagging [[himation]] would be appropriate then.

title: great_black-backed_gull

Sometimes mistakingly called "greatER black backed gull". Might be confused with the yellow legged lesser black backed gull (Larus fuscus) at a distance and where the feet aren't visible.

title: yvraine
body:

She leads the Ynnari, a faction of Eldar that worship Ynnead, Eldar God of the Dead.

She is often [[shipping (fandom)|shipped]] with the [[Ultramarines]] primarch [[Roboute Guilliman]] due to her role in awakening him.

title: ork_(warhammer)
body:
Playable race in [[Warhammer 40k]], the Orks are green-skinned fungus-based alien life forms who are completely obsessed with fighting, much like football hooligans in England, yelling "[[Waaagh!]]" as their battle cry. Notable for using the onomatopoeia "dakka" to describe the sound their beloved fully-automatic firearms make when firing continuously.

"”More Dakka!!”":[/pools/1388], an internet meme meaning something like "more firepower!!", originates from the tabletop game.

h4.See also

* [[Orc]] - similar humanoid race which orkz is based on.
* Wikipedia: "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ork_(Warhammer_40,000)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ork_%28Warhammer_40,000%29

title: eldar
body:
One of the main factions in [[Warhammer 40K]], the Eldar (stylized as Aeldari) are a highly-psychic, [[elf]]-like race whose history stretches back millions of years before the current setting. Once the most powerful empire in the galaxy, the Eldar would fall to unprecedented decadence and corruption, resulting in the formation of the Chaos god Slannesh and the fall of their empire (and with it, finishing off humanity's already-weakened pre-[[imperium of man|Imperial]] government, starting the Age of Strife). A few would survive aboard massive Craftworlds, having seen the impending fall and evacuating ahead of time. The Fall, however, continues to haunt their species, as Eldar who die and whose souls are not transferred to a special Soulstone are instead consumed by Slannesh.

In recent editions given the increased threat [[Chaos (warhammer)|]] poses to the galaxy, some Eldar groups have begrudgingly cooperated with the Imperium of Man, given their common enemy.

h4. See also

* [[Dark Eldar]]

title: alphamon
body:
A Holy Knight [[Digimon]]. Alphamon is a massive armored Digimon with a cape and wings. It is a natural carrier of the X-Antibody and displays it as a red triangle on its forehead. It is a member of the Royal Knights, and acts as the group's leader when present.

Alphamon is the Vaccine-attribute Ultimate form of the troubled [[DORUmon]]; its evolutionary brethren are [[DORUgoramon]] and [[Death-X-DORUgoramon]]. Its titles are "Aloof Hermit" (孤高の隠士, [i]Kokou no Inshi[/i]) and "Empty Seat" (空白の席, [i]Kuuhaku no Seki[/i]), both making reference to its habit of disappearing without a trace. 

It can merge with [[Ouryumon]], at which point it is referred to as [[Alphamon Ouryuuken]]. In this form, Ouryumon turns into a blade for Alphamon to wield, and its wings show more prominently.


According to [[Watanabe Kenji]], Alphamon's design is based on [[Zwarth]] ([[Seisenshi Dunbine]]) and [[Type J-9 Griffon]] ([[Kidou Keisatsu Patlabor]]).

title: blood_angels
body:
A popular chapter of the [[Adeptus Astartes]] from the [[Warhammer 40k]] franchise, distinguished by their bright red armor.

One of the original Space Marine legions, led by their [[Primarch]], [[Sanguinius]]. While they and most of their successor chapters are normally among the more compassionate groups of Space Marines, they suffer from two distinct flaws: the Red Thirst, which temporarily fills them with an insatiable bloodlust, and the Black Rage, in which a Marine suffers a lasting flashback to the death of Sanguinius and goes completely berserk. The latter is often incurable and sufferers are organized into "Death Companies".

title: space_wolves
body:
A chapter of the [[Adeptus Astartes]] in [[Warhammer 40k]]. Clad in primarily grey power armor, they are known for their Norse/Viking aesthetic and frequent references to wolves. Because of the latter trait, many in the fandom often joke about them being Furries. They are one of the original Space Marine legions and their [[Primarch]] is [[Leman Russ]], whose name would be used for the [[astra militarum|Imperial Guard's]] main battle tanks.

Their [[power armor|armor]] is colored in [[grey|grey armor]] or [[blue armor|blue]], with the [[shoulder armor]] colored in other colors as yellow, red, white or black. They heavily utilize symbology related to the wolves and often have feral aspects, with [[long hair]] and [[long beard]]s.

h4. External links 

* "Wiki page on Lexicanum":[https://wh40k.lexicanum.com/wiki/Space_Wolves]

title: julius_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Julius[/b] (ユリウス, [b]Yurius[/b] in the Japanese version) is a boss character from [[Fire Emblem: Genealogy of the Holy War]].

[spoiler]Julius is one of twin children born from the union of [[Arvis (fire emblem)|Arvis]] and [[Deirdre (Fire Emblem)|Deirdre]], the other being his sister and opposite [[Julia (Fire Emblem)|Julia]]. This also makes him the younger half-brother of [[Seliph (Fire Emblem)|Seliph]]. Being a full-blooded descendant of the Earth Dragon Loptous, Julius is the final result of [[Manfroy (Fire Emblem)|Manfroy]]'s schemes to groom an heir to the mad god. He was eventually consumed by the dragon's spirit, and proceeds to turn his father's empire into a twisted, barbaric land resembling the old Lopt Empire. He meets his end by Julia and the power of [[Naga (Fire Emblem)|]], the Divine Dragon goddess.[/spoiler]

title: primaris_space_marine
body:
A new breed of transhuman [[adeptus astartes|Space Marines]] in [[Warhammer 40K]], developed across the span of ten thousand standard years by Archmagos Dominus Belisarius Cawl on Mars on the order of Primarch [[Roboute Guilliman]]. Cawl used the genetic template of the original Space Marines created by the Emperor for His Great Crusade as the starting point for the development of the new Astartes. Primaris Space Marines are bigger, more physically powerful and possess faster reaction times than their original Astartes counterparts.

The way to different them from a regular Space Marine is their height and equipment, wearing the Mark X Tacticus Pattern Power Armour.

title: blood_ravens
body:
A chapter of the [[Adeptus Astartes]] from [[Warhammer 40K]]. First introduced in the PC RTS game [[Dawn of War]], the chapter have since appeared in both the tabletop and other 40k games as well. The chapter is known from their red armor and their emblem, a raven with a blood drop on its chest.

While generally well received amongst (most of) the Imperium for their protective nature over civilians and eagerness to deal death to the enemies of the Imperium, the Techpriests of Mars and the Inquisition due to their voracious appetite for knowledge, learning and artifacts in particular, the Blood Ravens have a mixed reputation amongst the other Space Marine chapters due to both their strategies (favoring extensive recon, meticulous planning and pinpoint assaults on key enemy vulnerabilities) and their Chapter-wide tendency to produce almost unprecedented numbers of psykers and Librarians. The Space Wolves (who favor strategies involving charges and overwhelming the foe in massed melee) infamously do not tolerate Blood Raven procedures at all, with physical altercations being recorded between the two chapters at command-level meetings.

As a second-founding chapter with no official records prior to M37K, the Blood Ravens do not (again officially) have a recognizable Primarch. However, their color scheme, tendency to produce psykers and culture surrounding the acquisition of knowledge strongly suggest that they are descendants of [[Magnus the Red]], making them loyalists of the [[Thousand Sons]] traitor legion. This would also make them an indirect relative chapter of the [[Grey Knight]]s due to sharing a Founder in Janus.

As the Blood Raven arsenal contains some phenomenally unlikely artifacts (Gear belonging to the Custodes and [i]Primarchs[/i] to name but a few) that would have been under enough security to make their theft near impossible, the Blood Ravens gained the fandom reputation of being able to perform implausible acts of indefinite borrowing, such as swapping places with a Land Raider's driver while he's still inside the cockpit, acquiring Bjorn the Fell-handed's Dreadnaught for combat use (with Bjorn catching on quickly to his new circumstances and happily embracing the chance to go back to war) and involuntarily renting the Golden Throne of Terra. 

The chapter have been jokingly called "The Bloody Magpies" by fans due to how the chapter are constantly gifted (or 'gifted', due to those same chapters not having any records stating that they ever gave the Ravens anything)  rare, powerful weapons and gear from other older chapters.  
Due to their memetic shenanigans, gateway status to the 40k world and generally being a interesting chapter, the Blood Ravens are well-regarded amongst the fandom - even if the jokes about rampant theft get a little repetitive.
